SENT.plain: Diagnostically and therapeutically, three types of angiodysplasias interfere with venous surgery: 1
Weber: secondary varicosis with local gigantism)--surgical reduction of the shunt-volume is usually indicated
Type Klippel-Trenaunay: Surgery for varicose veins is dangerous due to the frequent hypo- or aplasia of the deep venous system
Venous hemangiomatosis (Type Servelle-Martorell or Kasabach-Merritt): Any surgical intervention is contraindicated (only external compressive therapy)
